page.title: 07Lympstone-population.
page.content: In 1931 the population of Lympstone was 1042 and it now stands at around 1860, a relatively high increase especially in the last 20 years.A recent survey showed that about 35% of those asked had lived there for less than 10 years which confirms that Lympstone has proved attractive to the retired and to commuters working in Exeter.In East Devon,the 1981 census shows that 51% of the people are over 65 years of age,the figure here is lower but still worthy of note.Overall population density has also increased,helped by the building of estates,especially on the North side for Royal Marine families.Many of the newcomers are from London,the South East and the Midlands but most migration has been from within Devon.
